Your body is always [burning calories](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/simple-ways-burn-more-calories/) to keep your involuntary nervous system working—pumping blood, breathing, digesting food, and all the other life-sustaining jobs it performs. You've probably already heard that the more [muscle mass](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/nutrition/gain-mass/muscle-protein-synthesis-gets-you-bigger-and-stronger/) you have, the more calories your body is burning at rest, but did you know that you could also [burn calories and fat while you sleep](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-features/11-tips-get-stronger-while-you-sleep/)? With some minor tweaks to your daily habits, you can unleash the full potential of your body's natural fat-burning ability while you sleep.
